description: An introductory course covering basic computer concepts, including hardware, software, and essential skills for using computer applications.
Introduction to fundamental concepts of computer science, including algorithms, problem-solving techniques, and computational thinking.
Introduction to structured programming techniques, emphasizing problem-solving methodologies using a high-level programming language.
Examines ethical, legal, and social issues related to cybersecurity and digital citizenship, promoting responsible behavior in online environments.
Focuses on object-oriented programming concepts and techniques for building graphical user interfaces (GUIs) using a modern programming language.
Introduction to the principles and practices of cybersecurity, including threats, defenses, cryptography, and secure systems design.
Examines the principles and technologies used in enterprise computing environments, including distributed systems, cloud computing, and virtualization.
Studies the organization of computer systems, including CPU architecture, memory management, and introduction to assembly language programming.
Covers fundamental data structures (lists, trees, graphs) and algorithms (sorting, searching, graph algorithms) used in computer science.
Introduces software engineering principles and methodologies, including requirements analysis, design, implementation, testing, and maintenance.
Introduction to database concepts, relational database management systems (RDBMS), SQL programming, and database design principles.
Introduction to numerical methods for solving mathematical problems using computers, including interpolation, numerical integration, and solving linear equations.
Covers the architecture, protocols, and technologies used in computer networks, including local area networks (LANs) and wide area networks (WANs).
Focuses on the design, implementation, and management of local area networks (LANs), including network topology, protocols, and security.
Introduction to principles and techniques of computer graphics, including 2D and 3D graphics rendering, animation, and graphical user interfaces.
Examines principles and practices of network security, including cryptography, secure protocols, intrusion detection/prevention, and network defense strategies.
Introduction to Unix/Linux operating systems, including shell scripting, file systems, process management, and system administration.
Covers web programming languages, frameworks, and technologies used to develop dynamic web applications, including client-server architecture and database integration.

course_name: Seminar on the Computer Profession and Ethics
description: Examines ethical issues, professional responsibilities, and societal impacts related to the field of computer science and information technology.
Introduction to artificial intelligence (AI) concepts, including problem-solving methods, knowledge representation, machine learning, and AI applications.
Studies the architecture and organization of computer systems, including CPU design, memory hierarchy, input/output systems, and performance evaluation.
Examines advanced programming language concepts and paradigms, including functional programming, scripting languages, and language design principles.
Introduction to compiler design and implementation, including lexical analysis, syntax analysis, semantic analysis, code generation, and optimization.
Introduction to cryptographic techniques and algorithms, including encryption, decryption, digital signatures, and cryptographic protocols.
Focuses on digital investigation techniques, including data recovery, forensic analysis, evidence handling, and legal aspects of digital forensics.
Introduction to systems programming concepts, including operating system interfaces, system calls, process management, and concurrent programming.
Introduction to operating system principles and functionalities, including process scheduling, memory management, file systems, and system security.
Examines principles and practices of information assurance, including risk assessment, security policies, access controls, and secure system administration.
Examines formal models of computation, including automata theory, formal languages, computability, and complexity theory.
Focuses on designing, implementing, and deploying web services, including service-oriented architectures (SOA), APIs, and interoperability standards.
Examines cloud computing architectures, services, deployment models, and management tools, including virtualization, scalability, and security.
Focuses on software development methodologies, including agile practices, project management, team collaboration, and software quality assurance.
Seminar course covering advanced technical topics in computer science and related fields, including current research trends and emerging technologies.
Provides students with the opportunity to pursue an independent research project under the guidance of a faculty advisor, culminating in a written report or presentation.
Provides practical experience in applying management information systems (MIS) principles and practices in a professional work setting.
Provides practical experience in applying computer science principles and techniques in a professional work setting.
